tn.text: "firstborn; he was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])

tn.ref: Makir ... Abi Ezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida
tn.text: These are men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Makir's descendants were assigned the land of Gilead and Bashan
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Joshua assigned the land of Gilead and Bashan to Makir's descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Land was assigned ... given to their clans
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Joshua assigned land ... and gave them to their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah, and Tirzah
tn.text: These are women's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: to give to us an inheritance
tn.text: The land is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that the people received as a permanent possession. AT: "to give to us some land as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he gave those women an inheritance
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "Joshua gave those women an inheritance" or 2) "Eleazar gave those women an inheritance."

tn.ref: Ten parcels of land were assigned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Joshua assigned ten parcels of land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"Ten portions"
The land is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. AT: "received land as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The land of Gilead was assigned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Joshua assigned the land of Gilead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"toward the south"
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"The border of Manasseh's land"
a very small river
name of a brook (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: On the north side Asher can be reached
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) that the border of Manasseh's land on the north side touched the land that belonged to the tribe of Asher or 2) that one can travel north to reach Asher. AT: "Asher was on the north side" or "One can travel north to reach Asher" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. AT: "to the east, one can reach Issachar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Beth Shan ... Ibleam ... Dor ... Endor ... Taanach ... Megiddo ... Napheth
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Why have you given us only one ... Yahweh has blessed us?
tn.text: The people of the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh ask this question to emphasize that Joshua should have assigned to them more land. AT: "You should have given us more than one ... Yahweh has blessed us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: one assignment of land and one portion for an inheritance
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. In the second, the land is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that the people received as a permanent possession. AT: "one assignment of land as our inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
part
"many people"

tn.ref: If you are a people great in number
tn.text: "Since you are a people great in number"
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here the word "house" refers to the descendants. AT: "the descendants of Joseph" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"you will clear the forest of trees" or "you will cut down its trees"
